alert.note: Alert for Carquinez Strait and Delta; Motherlode; Northern San Joaquin Valley; Southern Sacramento Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Advisory issued April 03 at 2:23PM PDT until April 03 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM PDT THIS EVENING... ...FROST ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM TO 9 AM PDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Advisory, northwest winds 20 to 25 mph with gusts up to 40 mph expected. For Tuesday`s Frost Advisory, temperatures as low as 28 to 36 will result in frost formation. * WHERE...For the Wind Advisory, Southern Sacramento Valley from Sacramento south and the lower foothills of the Motherlode. For Tuesday`s Frost Advisory, areas below 2000 feet including the Southern Sacramento Valley and the Motherlode. * WHEN...Wind Advisory through 8 PM today. Frost Advisory from 2 AM to 9 AM PDT Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. Frost could kill sensitive outdoor vegetation if left uncovered. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Gusty northwesterly winds will persist into the early evening, diminishing tonight. Cold temperatures Tuesday morning will allow for areas of frost. Cold morning lows are also forecast for Wednesday morning but not as cold as Tuesday.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold.

area.areaDesc: Carquinez Strait and Delta; Motherlode; Northern San Joaquin Valley; Southern Sacramento Valley
